text: Robert Allen Katzmann (April 22, 1953 â€“ June 9, 2021) was an American politician and lawyer. He was a Judge of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit from 1999 until his death. He was nominated by President Bill Clinton. Katzmann was also the circuit's chief judge from 2013 until 2020. Katzmann was born in New York City. He studied at Columbia University, Yale University and Harvard University. Katzmann died on June 9, 2021 at a New York City hospital from pancreatic cancer, aged 68.Robert Katzmann, U.S. Judge With Reach Beyond the Bench, Dies at 68 ==References== Category:1953 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American judges Category:Lawyers from New York City Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Robert Katzmann
